MyElevationProxy.name: OrientedElevationFilter
MyElevationProxy.label: Oriented Elevation

Documentation.long_help: Creates point array representing elevation defaulting in the z-direction
Documentation.short_help: Creates point array representing elevation defaulting in the z-direction

MyElevationProxy.Documentation:
The Elevation filter generates point scalar values for an input dataset along a specified direction vector.
The Input menu allows the user to select the data set to which this filter will be applied. Use the Scalar range entry boxes to specify the minimum and maximum scalar value to be generated. The Low Point and High Point define a line onto which each point of the data set is projected. The minimum scalar value is associated with the Low Point, and the maximum scalar value is associated with the High Point. The scalar value for each point in the data set is determined by the location along the line to which that point projects.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input dataset to the Elevation filter.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ScalarRange
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines the range into which scalars will be mapped.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: LowPoint
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Low Point
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property defines one end of the direction vector (small scalar values).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: HighPoint
DoubleVectorProperty.label: High Point
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property defines the other end of the direction vector (large scalar values).
